2021.expert_review:
What Is the 2021 Audi Q8?

The five-seat Audi Q8 blends coupelike design with SUV versatility. It’s powered by a standard 335-horsepower, turbocharged 3.0-liter V-6 engine that works with an eight-speed automatic transmission. All-wheel drive is standard, and competitors include the BMW X6 and Land Rover Range Rover Velar. The performance-oriented SQ8 features a twin-turbocharged V-8 engine that makes 500 hp. 

What’s New on the 2021 Audi Q8?

Blind spot warning is newly standard. 

What Features in the 2021 Audi Q8 Are Most Important?

Standard features include: 

Full-LED headlights with high-beam assist
Power liftgate
Navigation
Dual-touchscreen control system 
Apple CarPlay and Android Auto smartphone connectivity
Panoramic moonroof 
Leather upholstery
Heated front seats

Available features include: 

Heated steering wheel
Heated rear seats
Ventilated front seats
Bang & Olufsen premium stereo
360-degree camera system
Adaptive air suspension 
Head-up display 
Should I Buy the 2021 Audi Q8?

Even though the Q8 puts style ahead of functionality with its sleek looks, it still has a large backseat. Interior quality is impressive, and so is the Q8’s ride quality and outward visibility. Acceleration lag, however, is a problem, and the drivetrain’s stop-start system isn’t great. The SUV also gets expensive in upper trim levels.

2023.expert_review:
What Is the 2023 Audi Q8?

The 2023 Audi Q8 is a mid-size luxury SUV with two rows of seats and a design that emphasizes speed and sportiness. A 335-horsepower, turbocharged 3.0-liter V-6 engine is standard and comes with an eight-speed automatic transmission and all-wheel drive. Stepping up to an SQ8 or RS Q8 brings a twin-turbo V-8 engine that produces 500 or 591 hp, respectively. This gives the Q8 the performance of an outright sports car — not to mention the price of one, too. An RS Q8 starts at approximately $127,000, which is about $54,000 more than an entry-level Q8.

According to Cars.com’s own cargo measurements, the SQ8 offers 20.2 cubic feet of cargo space behind its backseat. If you plan on toting children with any regularity, you can check how the Q8 scored in our Car Seat Check. Competitors include the Land Rover Range Rover Velar, Mercedes-Benz GLE-Class, Porsche Cayenne and Maserati Levante.

What’s New on the 2023 Audi Q8?

The 2023 Audi Q8 is largely the same as the previous model year. Updates include some new standard features and trim shuffling. Headlight washers, upgraded LED headlights and animated exterior lighting when approaching or departing the vehicle are newly standard. The Convenience Package adds adaptive cruise control with lane departure steering assist; remote park assist is included on the range-topping Prestige trim; and three new exterior colors have been added to the Q8’s palette.

What Features in the 2023 Audi Q8 Are Most Important?

Standard features include:

All-wheel drive
10.1-inch infotainment screen
8.6-inch climate control screen
Virtual Cockpit digital gauge cluster
Panoramic moonroof
Leather-trimmed seats
Heated front seats
Tri-zone automatic climate control
Navigation
Apple CarPlay and Android Auto smartphone connectivity
Adaptive suspension

Available features include:

Four-zone climate control
Heated steering wheel
Heated rear seats
Ventilated front seats
Bang & Olufsen premium stereo
Head-up display
360-degree camera system
Wireless device charging
Night vision
Adaptive air suspension
Four-wheel steering
Should I Buy the 2023 Audi Q8?

The Audi Q8 is a luxury SUV that wants to be a sports car, and it succeeds in terms of its aggressive shape and hunkered-down stance. The twin-turbo V-8s used in the SQ8 and RS Q8 provide scintillating performance, but their price tags could make you wince. Impeccable cabin quality and two rows of spacious seating add a dollop of practicality. That said, Audi’s own Q7 SUV is not only less expensive, but it has three rows of seats and more cargo space.

2026.expert_review:
Key points:

For the 2026 model year, the Audi Q8 SUV starts at $76,895 (all prices include $1,295 destination fee).
The Premium Plus and Prestige trims get more standard features for 2026.
The SQ8 and RS Q8 performance models carry over unchanged.

For 2026, the Audi Q8 luxury SUV rolls into the new model year with more standard features and available option packages on certain trims, while the 500-horsepower SQ8 and 631-hp RS Q8 carry over unchanged. For 2026, the Q8 starts at $76,895.

Related: 2025 Audi RS Q8 Performance: Brand’s Most Powerful Combustion Engine Starts at $137,495

What’s New?

After a refresh for 2024, the 2026 Q8 SUV arrives with more standard features on the mid-grade Premium Plus and top Prestige trims. The five-seat variant of the three-row Audi Q7, the Q8 represents a sportier take on the luxury SUV, especially with the SQ8 and top RS Q8 Performance variant that was updated for 2025.

The Q8’s base Premium trim can be had with a Convenience Plus Package that blackens certain exterior trim bits and adds more luxurious interior features, such as a heated steering wheel and Bang & Olufsen sound system. The Premium Plus trim now gets dual-pane acoustic glass on the side windows for a more hushed ride, ventilated front seats, heated rear seats and other soft touches. (The SQ8 starts with the Premium Plus trim.)

For 2026, the range-topping Prestige adds rear-axle steering for more nimble handling at speed and for easier parking at low speeds. A Sport Plus Package takes a half-step to the SQ8 with an adaptive air suspension, red brake calipers, 23-inch wheels wrapped in summer tires and massaging front seats. (The RS Q8 only comes in the top Prestige trim and includes the goodies in the Sport Plus Package.)

Pricing and Release Date

The 2026 Audi Q8 family is on sale now. Full line pricing is as follows.

Q8
Premium: $76,895
Premium Plus: $82,095
Prestige: $87,495
SQ8
Premium Plus: $100,995
Prestige: $108,495
RS Q8
Prestige: $139,595
Powertrain Specs and MPG

The turbocharged V-6 and twin-turbocharged V-8 engines carry over in the 2026 Q8 family. The Q8’s turbocharged 3.0-liter V-6 makes 335 hp and 369 pounds-feet of torque. The SQ8 has a 500-hp, twin-turbocharged 4.0-liter V-8 churning out 568 pounds-feet, shaving the 0-60 mph time from 5.5 to 4.0 seconds. Then there’s the RS Q8 with the altered V-8 tuned to 631 hp and 627 pounds-feet; it hits 60 mph in just 3.4 seconds. All three models send power through an eight-speed automatic transmission to Audi’s signature Quattro all-wheel drive.

Official EPA ratings for the 2026 Q8 lineup are not yet available, but Audi says the SUV gets the same EPA estimates as the 2025 model. The EPA rates the 2025 Q8 at 17/23/19 mpg city/highway/combined, while the SQ8 returns 15/21/17 mpg. The RS Q8’s trade-off is a slash rating of 14/20/16 mpg.

Research the Audi Q8
Safety Features

Audi equips the 2026 Q8 with a comprehensive suite of advanced safety systems. Standard equipment includes forward collision warning with pedestrian detection and automatic emergency braking, adaptive cruise control, lane-centering steering, blind spot monitors, rear cross-traffic alert, front and rear parking sensors, traffic-sign recognition and automatic high beams. Optional safety equipment includes an upgraded forward collision warning system that watches for cross traffic during turns, an automated parking system, a 360-degree parking camera, a head-up display and a night-vision camera.

2022.expert_review:
What Is the 2022 Audi Q8?

The five-seat Audi Q8 blends sleek and aggressive styling with SUV size and versatility. The Q8 comes with a 335-horsepower, turbocharged 3.0-liter V-6 engine that works with an eight-speed automatic transmission. All-wheel drive is standard. Performance SQ8 and RS Q8 versions are also offered, featuring turbocharged V-8 engines that make 500 and 591 hp, respectively.

Competitors include the BMW X6, Land Rover Range Rover Velar and Maserati Levante. The SQ8 offers 20.2 cubic feet of cargo space behind its backseat, according to Cars.com’s cargo measurements. You can see how it scored in our Car Seat Check here.

What’s New on the 2022 Audi Q8?

New standard features include 21-inch wheels, power-folding heated side mirrors, and rear-seat side-impact airbags. New standard features for the SQ8, meanwhile, include adaptive cruise control and lane assist.

What Features in the 2022 Audi Q8 Are Most Important?

Standard features include:

Power liftgate
Panoramic moonroof
Leather-trimmed seats
Heated front seats
Tri-zone automatic air conditioning
Digital instrument panel
Dual-touchscreen control system
Navigation
Apple CarPlay and Android Auto smartphone connectivity
Adaptive suspension

Available features include:

Four-zone automatic air conditioning
Heated steering wheel
Heated rear seats
Ventilated front seats
Bang & Olufsen premium stereo
Head-up display
360-degree camera system
Wireless device charging
Night vision system
Adaptive air suspension
Four-wheel steering
Should I Buy the 2022 Audi Q8?

There’s no doubt the Q8 puts style ahead of practicality, with sleek looks and a tapered tail. To its credit, it still has a large backseat, and its cabin quality is impressive. Ride quality and outward visibility are also highlights, but acceleration lag is a problem, and the drivetrain’s stop-start system isn’t great.

2024.expert_review:
What Is the 2024 Audi Q8?

The Audi Q8 is a mid-size luxury SUV with two rows of seats and a design that emphasizes speed and sportiness. A 335-horsepower, turbocharged 3.0-liter V-6 engine is standard and comes with an eight-speed automatic transmission and all-wheel drive. Stepping up to an SQ8 or RS Q8 brings a twin-turbo V-8 engine that produces 500 or 591 hp, respectively. This gives the Q8 the performance of an outright sports car — not to mention the price of one, too. An RS Q8 starts at approximately $127,000, which is about $54,000 more than an entry-level Q8. 

According to Cars.com’s own cargo measurements, the SQ8 offers 20.2 cubic feet of cargo space behind its backseat. If you plan on toting children with any regularity, you can check how the Q8 scored in our Car Seat Check. Competitors include the Land Rover Range Rover Velar, Mercedes-Benz GLE-Class, Porsche Cayenne and Maserati Levante. 

What’s New on the 2024 Audi Q8?

Changes to the Q8 and SQ8 for 2024 include new front and rear styling touches, including Matrix-design LED headlights, new wheel designs and paint colors, and some interior trim updates. Other new options include LED headlights with Audi’s laser-light high beams and customizable daytime running light signatures. The high-performance RS Q8 carries on without the styling updates, but does receive a few minor feature changes.

What Features in the 2024 Audi Q8 Are Most Important?

Standard features include: 

AWD
10.1-inch infotainment screen
8.6-inch climate control screen
Virtual cockpit digital gauge cluster
Panoramic moonroof 
Leather-trimmed seats
Heated front seats
Tri-zone automatic climate control
Navigation
Apple CarPlay and Android Auto smartphone connectivity
Adaptive suspension

Available features include:

Heated steering wheel

Ventilated front seats
Bang & Olufsen premium stereo system

360-degree camera system

Night vision

Four-wheel steering
Should I Buy the 2024 Audi Q8?

The Q8 is a luxury SUV that wants to be a sports car, and it succeeds in terms of its aggressive shape and hunkered-down stance. The twin-turbo V-8s used in the SQ8 and RS Q8 provide scintillating performance, but their price tags could make you wince. Impeccable cabin quality and two rows of spacious seating add a dollop of practicality. That said, Audi’s own Q7 SUV is not only less expensive, but it has three rows of seats and more cargo space.

2020.expert_review:
Audi has announced pricing details on the forthcoming 2020 Audi SQ8, with the performance-oriented luxury SUV-coupe thingy set to debut in the spring.
Related: 2020 Audi SQ7 and SQ8: 6 Things Performance SUV Shoppers Will Wanna Know

  
    
  
    The SQ8 will be offered in two trim levels, Premium Plus and Prestige. The Premium Plus will start at $89,995 while the Prestige checks in at $95,495, both slightly higher than the SQ7, which starts at $85,795 (all prices include a $995 destination charge). These two vehicles are very similar, sharing the same powertrain, suspension upgrades and prospective release date.
The SQ8 is one of three Q8 variants that will be offered by Audi, with the regular and S versions arriving in 2020, and the completely bonkers RS Q8 coming later as a 2021 model. The SQ8 serves as a middle ground for the Q8 lineup, its 500-horsepower, twin-turbocharged 4.0-liter V-8 splitting the difference between the 335-hp Q8 and the 591-hp RS Q8.
I’m happy to see the arrival of the SQ8 (and the SQ7, for that matter) as I was not a fan of the turbocharged 3.0-liter V-6 found in the Q7 or the Q8. A step up to a more responsive powertrain would go a long way toward making those two vehicles feel more lively, and of course the prospect of a big SUV rumbling from 0-60 mph in just 4.3 seconds is fun to imagine.
In addition to the larger engine, the SQ8 also features all-wheel steering and all-wheel drive standard. It will also offer active roll stabilization and a rear sport differential for added agility.
The SQ8’s exterior design only hints at the performance punch it carries. It looks much the same as the regular Q8 from a distance, but closer inspection reveals small touches like a prominent rear diffuser, quad exhaust tips, and aluminum trim on the grille and mirror caps. A Black-optic Package will also be offered that adds 22-inch wheels and a slew of black exterior accents.
The five-seat SQ8 doesn’t skimp on interior features, with heated and ventilated sport seats, four-zone automatic climate control, a panoramic moonroof, a Bang & Olufsen sound system, Virtual Cockpit and a pair of dashboard screens all come standard. A 360-degree camera system, automattic forward emergency braking, side exit assist and blind spot monitors are also standard, giving the SQ8 a better set of standard safety features than you’ll find on most Audis.

2025.expert_review:
What Is the 2025 Audi Q8?
The Audi Q8 is a mid-size luxury SUV with two rows of seats and a design that emphasizes speed and sportiness. A 335-horsepower, turbocharged 3.0-liter V-6 engine is standard and teams with an eight-speed automatic transmission and all-wheel drive. Stepping up to the SQ8 or RS Q8 brings a twin-turbo V-8 engine that produces 500 and 631 hp, respectively. This gives the Q8 the performance of an outright sports car — not to mention the price of one, too. An RS Q8 starts at approximately $137,000, which is about $62,000 more than an entry-level Q8. The Q8 family’s competitors include the Land Rover Range Rover Velar, Mercedes-Benz GLE-Class, Porsche Cayenne and Maserati Levante.
What’s New on the 2025 Audi Q8?
Changes to the Q8 and SQ8 for 2025 are minimal, comprising new option packages and additional standard equipment. Meanwhile, the RS Q8 gets a styling refresh similar to the face-lift its siblings received last year, and it now comes solely as a Performance variant with 631 hp (40 more than last year’s RS Q8) and other high-performance touches.
